metadata.name: Rebuild Performance Counter Values Via Lodctr.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of "lodctr.exe" to rebuild the performance counter registry values. This can be abused by attackers by providing a malicious config file to overwrite performance counter configuration to confuse and evade monitoring and security solutions.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\lodctr.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('lodctr.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -r')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /r')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' –r')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' —r')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ―r'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of "lodctr.exe" to rebuild the performance counter registry values. This can be abused by attackers by providing a malicious config file to overwrite performance counter configuration to confuse and evade monitoring and security solutions.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate usage by an administrator Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/identity-protection/virtual-smart-cards/virtual-smart-card-tpmvscmgr
